questions.text: Two triangles are similar if their corresponding angles are equal.

questions.text: If two triangles have a scale factor of 3:1, the ratio of their areas is 9:1.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Area scales by the square of the linear scale factor: 3² = 9

questions.text: sin²θ + cos²θ = 1 for all angles θ.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: This is the Pythagorean identity, derived from the Pythagorean theorem.

draggableItems: Conclude triangles are similar
Identify two pairs of congruent angles

questions.text: If sin θ = 0.6, what is cos θ in a right triangle (assuming θ is acute)?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Using sin²θ + cos²θ = 1: 0.36 + cos²θ = 1, so cos²θ = 0.64, cos θ = 0.8

questions.text: What is tan 45°?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: In a 45-45-90 triangle, opposite = adjacent, so tan 45° = 1

questions.text: In a 30-60-90 triangle with hypotenuse 10, what is the length of the shorter leg?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: The shorter leg is half the hypotenuse in a 30-60-90 triangle.

questions.text: Two figures are similar if one can be obtained from the other by a sequence of rotations, reflections, translations, and dilations.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: A ladder 13 feet long leans against a wall. If the base is 5 feet from the wall, how high up the wall does the ladder reach?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Using Pythagorean theorem: 13² = 5² + h², so h² = 169 - 25 = 144, h = 12

questions.text: Match each similarity criterion to its requirements.

rightItems: All three pairs of corresponding sides proportional
Two pairs of proportional sides with included angle congruent

Measure the distance from the building

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: This is the Triangle Proportionality Theorem (Side-Splitter Theorem).

questions.text: From a point 50 meters from the base of a tower, the angle of elevation to the top is 60°. What is the height of the tower?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: tan 60° = height/50, so height = 50 × tan 60° = 50√3

questions.text: In similar triangles, corresponding angles are congruent and corresponding sides are congruent.

questions.explanation: In similar triangles, corresponding sides are proportional, not necessarily congruent.

questions.text: If tan θ = 3/4, what is sin θ (assuming θ is in the first quadrant)?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: With opposite = 3, adjacent = 4, hypotenuse = 5 (3-4-5 triangle), sin θ = 3/5

questions.text: In a right triangle, if one acute angle is 35°, what is the other acute angle?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: The two acute angles in a right triangle sum to 90°: 90° - 35° = 55°

questions.text: Order the steps to use SSS Similarity to prove triangles are similar.

questions.text: The sine and cosine of complementary angles are equal.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: sin θ = cos(90° - θ) for any angle θ

questions.text: A tree casts a shadow 20 feet long. If the angle of elevation of the sun is 45°, how tall is the tree?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: tan 45° = height/20, so height = 20 × 1 = 20 feet

questions.text: If a dilation has scale factor 0.5, the image is smaller than the pre-image.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: When 0 < k < 1, the dilation produces a reduction.

questions.text: What is the geometric mean of 4 and 9?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Geometric mean = √(4 × 9) = √36 = 6

questions.text: In triangle ABC, if AB/DE = BC/EF = AC/DF = 3, then triangle ABC is similar to triangle DEF.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: This satisfies SSS Similarity - all corresponding sides are proportional.

questions.text: In a 45-45-90 triangle with leg length 7, what is the length of the hypotenuse?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: In a 45-45-90 triangle, hypotenuse = leg × √2 = 7√2

questions.text: If two triangles are congruent, they are also similar.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Congruent triangles have equal angles and sides with ratio 1:1, satisfying similarity.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: In any triangle, the longer side is opposite the larger angle.

questions.text: If sin θ = cos θ, what is θ (for 0° < θ < 90°)?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: sin θ = cos θ when θ + θ = 90°, so θ = 45°
